message: Combine what would look nice as a picture on the wall.
Remember how each ingredient reacts and make logical combinations. Everything does not need to be combined to get 100
The mutation serum always takes points. Growth serum is really good.
You can individually get each creature high by doing mutant>growth>mutant>growth. After doing that you can combine up to 3 of them. I haven't figured out how to combine all 4.
Be satisfied with a positive outcome even if its not 100. Hold down onto ingredients once you cut or framed theme to understand if they are artifical, natural, soft or hard.
Don't touch the vial...its worthless.
This one is easy...just don't get too complicated.
You can combine up to three. You can use the growth serum multiple times on the same animal.
Use scissors twice on every object, combine the 2 objects with a high value, then frame those combined objects.
Use the stove but many ingredients are iffy. The water is not your friend.
It is more favorable in the long run to combine two animals that are from the same environment and not use the mutation.
combine three items. use both water and stove. Combinations can be things you have never had before. Some can add up to 100. Try to make cooked soaked bread and bean stew.

Use stove on all ingredients. Ingredients that don't benefit from stove you can use water on. Combine 3 of the highest rated ingredients, 2 should have used stove, and one should have used water. Ignore the 4th ingredient.
Stay away from the mutation
The vial and filter do not work together
See how each object response to vile and filter then combine the highest value ones.
Careful combining ingredients with frame. Use scissors with items that make sense
Group cut-able objects together and add scissors. Then group non cut-able objects together with frame.
Cooking something twice doesn't make it better, and most times will make it negative. I tried making a BLT and it was marked as overcomplicated, so try and stick to only 3 ingredients mixed together.
Cutting something twice can make it finely cut if cutting it once is negative. Combine two finely cut or regularly cut items and then frame them
most liquids can be filtered, and solids can be extracted with vial. Go with your gut.
You should not add stove and water together. And also raw food are best for the stove.
it is hard

It seems like the frame tool was a bad option, resulting in heavy losses when adding ingredients to it. The scissors tool was better and did well when using ingredient paper and wood OR paper and shell. Scissors was capable of large losses as well but the above 2 examples should be good.
Filter things that aren't solid and then combine those filtered items. Put solids in vials and then combine the items in vials.
Combining vial or filter or even both with anything gives you 30 points mostly.
it is impossible to reach 80
Use growth until an animal gets to 15 before combining. Do not combine more than three animals. Mutate only twice after combining three animals.

Okay, so I think the key is to avoid the nutation catalyst and focus on the growth serum. Be careful not to make a crazy hybrid creature (selecting lots of ingredients) because you'll get this message:
too many is overcomplicated
and you will lose points
Try combining natural and artificial soft first then cut to get 80
this is really hard to combine
Don't overmix!! Play with a few things and keep moving
try your best it will run out of time
I found the stove scored the most points. Try makinbg combinations you think would actually taste good. Don't make it overcomplicated. Avoid bread.

I did not solve this puzzle. Max I got was 80 points.
There is meat, protein, vegetable, and grain. 4 ingredients will overcomplicate your dish, only use 3 ingredients.

You can make all kinds of dishes: salads, sandwiches, skillet, medley, tortillas, stew. I did not explore stew much. Soaking the beans and rice didn't do much but maybe I did it in the wrong order.

Cooked protein/meat + cooked vegetable + grain = 80
Cooked meat + cooked vegetable + cooked vegetable = 80
Cooked vegetable + cooked vegetable + cooked rice = 80
The objects always have the same reaction with either item

as a gerenal rule but don't overdo it or it will be too complicated

cut hard things twice for points, then frame. play with different ideas but leave one thing to cut and frame if the other things fail

Vial for extract, filter for filter. Combine the best outcome extract with the best outcome filter for most of the highest-scoring results. There are some exceptions, such as one where 2 extracts can be combined.

vial extracts. sometimes vial twice works. filter bad stuff (ink, poison). vial good things, then add the vial and filtered together. always leave an element to get points if you screw everything else up
Always frame last as combining something already framed will break the frame.
let him cook. dont overcomplicate. take 60
Combine two of the four animals after aging them a few times (or max,) then with those two you combined add a couple mutations. Repeat for the other two animals left.
Don't use the scissors on everything. Try to think about making an arts and craft frame to try and help.
Cook everything you use. Don't combine everything though.
Filter non-solids. Vial the solids. Combine the ones that seem more alike.

Difficult to find a pattern. The catalyst always seemed to result in negative points. Combining animals I was unable to find a helpful pattern. Using growth 2 or 3 times seemed to result in some negative points. I started deciding to just leave the animals separated and give them only one growth, otherwise, I would end up with negative points as my score.
mutation isnt reliable. Overgrowth is bad. No real world application.

I would suggest not trying to over complicate things. And some recipes are strange, but high value, such as cooked mushroom-beet sandwich for 60 points. Combining or cooking too much usually turns it into zero points.
Use filter for liquids. Use vial for solids. only combine two finished items not 3.

Here are tips for several different rounds to maximize your points:  
Grab the beans but don't soak them, just cook them

Soak rice in water and then cook on stove

Then, combine the cooked beans with the soaked rice

Cook the bacon with stove. Then, put bread on TOP of bacon

Cook fish on stove. Then, add fresh mushrooms but don't cook them. Then, add corn on top of fish and mushroom

Cook egg on stove. Then cook potato separately with stove. Then, place potato on top of egg.

Cook beans, potatoes and mushrooms separately with stove. Then, place potatoes on top of beans. Then, place mushrooms on top of potatoes

use stove, pepper, raw beef.

grain and water are spoilers

It is very confusing to figure this one out. I would suggest keeping it simple. Keep at least one item worth 30 points on the board. I wasn't able to figure out the pattern, sometimes extractions fail and I gave up on filtering because it kept ruining some times. I stuck 30 points most rounds by being cautious to avoid getting zero points.
avoid mutation catalyst and the trout and make sure you dont combine everything
Some real world application. cook raw foods. Cook veggies. i stpped at mixing 3 items.
You can only place ONE item in frame or it ruins the frame and you get a negative score.  So, place ribbons, sunflower, leaf or mushroom on top of frame by themselves.
Use stove not water. Use combo of veggie, protein, and grain. Don't use more than 3 ingredients
Mutation barely ever is good.  Also, putting growth serum on panda, whale, lion, kangaroo, snake, elephant. zebra or shark produces most points

Do not combine more than 2 objects before cutting or framing. If I had 3 cuttable items, I used one with a non cuttable item.

1st user: Don't overmix!!! Use your best logic (cut paper, soft with soft, etc). 2nd user: Mixing isnt working well. Hard to figure combos. Cut items seem to match. Most i got was 50 using only cut items. Experiment with soft items so you can add feedback for the next person.

Here are tips for several different rounds to maximize your points:

Grab the beans but don't soak them, just cook them

Soak rice in water and then cook on stove

Then, combine the cooked beans with the soaked rice

Cook the bacon with stove. Then, put bread on TOP of bacon

Cook fish on stove. Then, add fresh mushrooms but don't cook them. Then, add corn on top of fish and mushroom

Cook egg on stove. Then cook potato separately with stove. Then, place potato on top of egg.

Cook beans, potatoes and mushrooms separately with stove. Then, place potatoes on top of beans. Then, place mushrooms on top of potatoes.

You can combine ingredients to make stews.

It is very easy to get a score of 100 on each round.
First when you hover over the items you will see if they are a solid, gas, liquid and either magical or mudane.  And solids you should merge with the vial.  Any gas or liquids you should merge with the filter.  Then take one mudane item that is worth 30 points and one magical item worth 30 points and combine them and you will get a 100 point item.

to score 100 every time there is only one way. you first have to put each individual ingredient in a vial or filter it. If it is solid you HAVE to put it in a vial, but if it is gas or liquid, you HAVE to filter it. make sure one is mundane and one is magical. it does not matter if you use solid/liquid/gas, as long as one if mundane and one is magical after you filter it or vial it. once you have one filter/vialed mundane, and one filtered/vialed magical, you combine them together and it'll score 100. combining two magical or two mundane will score 60. combining more than two can drop the score because it becomes over complicated.

Don't combine all ingredients. That would always bring my score back to zero. It seems water does nothing to add points. Adding as many meats as possible usually resulted in the highest scores. Combining three ingredients usually resulted in the highest scores I got.

You want to make the best possible combination of 2 animals. Use growth serum once on each animal, and combine the two largest animals together with both animals living in different areas (land + air , air+water, or land+water) to get an extra 5 points beyond the sum of the two animal scores. In some cases, the two largest animals are living in the same area, and you will not gain extra for the hybrid bonus between 2 animals living in different areas. If you use the growth serum twice on one animal, its score will go negative. The mutation catalyst will always make an animal go negative.
3 ingredients work best for points. Anything over 3 will give you negative points

In the initial rounds, experiment with ingredients that have low starting values (Value 0). They often contain a Level 1 feature that the tools can quickly elevate to Level 3 or 4, making them highly profitable. Don't waste tools on ingredients that already have a mid-range value (e.g., 30-40), as they may be closer to their value cap.

Quick Tips for Success:
Tools (grey) can be reusedapply them to high-value items after combining.
Combine lower-value ingredients first; some items (like high-value ones) give 0 if combined.
Track combinations and results in the scratchpad.
Your score is the highest-value item, so focus on maximizing one or two items.
Experiment with order: tool  combine or combine  tool for best results.
Most solid things are for the vial not filtering.  Honeys, winds, liquids, those need to be filtered.

You should filter liquid items and "extract" (with the vial) solid items. Once filtered or extracted, you can combine one magical and one mundane to get something worth 100. If you have only mundane items, you can extract one of them, then expose that extract to a gas/vapor, then filter to get a final extract worth 100.

Use the filter on liquids & gas. Use the Vial on solids. 1 mundane + 1 magical always. Do not combine them until they are in the same state. Filtered gas & extracted solids become liquids.

I would recommend combining three of the animals, adding the growth serum once, then the mutation catalyst twice (the first time will lower the score, the second will raise it), then adding the growth serum a second time will sometimes raise the score and sometimes lower it, so it's a chance you have to take depending on how high your score is after the 2 mutation catalysts. Adding too many animals together or adding either of the mutation catalysts or growth serum too many times will tank your score.

1. Combine solids with a vial 
2. Combine liquids and gasses with a filter.

3. Combine one filtered/extracted mundane ingredient with an filtered/extracted magical ingredient.

To get maxium points, first add together a land animal and an ocean animal. Once those are combined, then add a flying animal. After that, you should be up to about 5 or 10 points. Then add the growth serum ONLY ONCE. It will get you up to 30-45 points. Don't add the growth serum more than once or it will reduce points. Don't ever add the mutation tool! It will bring your points way down. Also, don't ever combine all 4 animals! It takes your points way down.

So in summation: 1 land animal + 1 sea animal + 1 flying animal + growth serum = best result
